p: Additionally, Heather Friberg et al. [ 137] suggested that as the release of the CD8 mediators was sequential starting with MIP-1b, that the mono-functional response maybe due to inherent features of the epitope variant sequence effecting the length of TCR interaction. A process referred to by the Weiskopf group [ 105] as altered peptide ligands (APL) [ 140]. It has been suggested that cross-reactive CD8s may preferentially bind to heterotypic epitope variants [ 127], however this is not the case and instead epitope preference is due to inherent properties of the peptides affecting HLA avidity [ 128].
